sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The advancement of merchandize or, Certain propositions for the improvment of the trade of this Common-wealth, humbly presented to the right honoroble the Council of State. And also, against the transporting of gold and silver. / By Tho. Violet of London goldsmith. Violet, Thomas, fl. 1634-1662.
[20], 158, [10] p.
Printed by William Du-Gard, Printer to the Council of State, London : anno Dom. 1651.
"A true discoverie to the commons of England" has separate dated title page, pagination and register are continuous. Annotation on Thomason copy: "feb: 17th.", "1650"; imprint date crossed through. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Printed by William Du-Gard, Printer to the Council of State, London : anno Dom. 1651.
"A true discoverie to the commons of England" has separate dated title page, pagination and register are continuous. Annotation on Thomason copy: "feb: 17th.", "1650"; imprint date crossed through. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
